H0.text: what places make up new england. New Hampshire

H1.text: what places make up new england. Vermont

H2.text: what places make up new england. Massachusetts

H3.text: what places make up new england. Maine

A4.text: Maine alone constitutes nearly one-half of the total area of New England, yet is only the 39th-largest state, slightly smaller than Indiana.

A5.text: New England is a region consisting of six states in the Northeastern United States: Connecticut, Maine, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, Rhode Island, and Vermont.

A6.text: Connecticut (  kə-NET-ih-kət) is a state in the New England region of the Northeastern United States.

A9.text: Maine is a state in the New England region of the Northeastern United States.

A10.text: Maine is the northernmost and largest state in New England.
